name: Crowne Plaza Columbus Downtown

reviews.text: Negatives: If you've over 50 think twice. Phones, Dream Machine alarm clock not user friendly - intuitive -- and who needs that when they are tired! Flat sceen tv doesn't have adjustment for High Def vs. normal, so much distortion (fat heads!). ONE packet of coffee and ONE packet of decaf provided and then coffee pot didn't work (I discovered it was the outlet luckily, so moved it and got my one little cup of caffeine -- which is all you're going to get out of them for free). Had to get expensive coffee in lobby. Last day my hubbie grabbed a cup for me and paid (before 6:00 a.m.) service. Luke warm, so when we hit the road asked for a little "warm up" and the girl poured about 1" of hot coffee on top. I guess that's all they could part with for a guest. Parking is $21 (norm, I guess), you PAY for internet. Front desk had ATTITUDE, more than once. Remodeled rooms were CRAMPED. ok, nice bedding and ok mattress. Bathroom pretty, but one outlet (see coffee pot) didn't work. I would much rather go the the Wyndham and be treated well, get my freebie breakfast.
reviews.title: ok rooms - lots of YOUNG employees with ATTITUDE

reviews.text: I was in town for a concert at the Nationwide Arena (a short walk down the street) so I only had a two night stay. I had never stayed at a Crowne Plaza and the only photo's I had seen where before the renovation, so I was a little hesitant. This was by far the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at. From the valet, to the front desk, even the room service, the entire staff was friendly and willing to go out of there way to help with whatever was needed. We where pleasantly suprised at how nice our room was, as well as the quietness. This was the first hotel I had stayed in where I actually fell at home and got a good nights rest. The bathroom was beautiful (LOVED the showerhead!), and the room service was prompt and tasty. The only thing really that was not perfect was the quality of the TV. The picture was bad but that was no big deal to us. The complementary wireless made up for that.
reviews.title: Beautiful Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: I was very impressed by the rooms at the Crowne Plaza Columbus Downtown. They look like they've been remodeled recently as the furnishings are very modern. The room we stayed in was like a suite. It had a small couch and a chair with an ottoman that you could sit in to watch TV (flatscreen) although you could also watch TV from the bed. The mattress was VERY comfortable to sleep on. The bathroom was nice too, and everything was very clean.
reviews.title: Beautiful, modern rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative thing about this hotel is the limited parking, which should be expected since it's downtown. You have to pay for parking whether you do valet or self-park.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: We stayed one night here for a wedding and it was a nice stay. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Check-in and check-out were both quick and easy. The elevator gave us some problems on arrival and wouldn't take us all the way to our floor (11th) so we rode up and down and finally it worked. The room service menu was from Max and Irma's which made for a really nice late night snack. The parking was pretty expensive at 21.00 per night but there was really no other option. The hotel is right across from Nationwide Arena and we had a good view of it from our window.
reviews.title: It was a fine place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night after watching the footy. We didn't normally stay here when in Columbus but got a great price on Priceline, and I'm glad that we did. Easily accessible from the highway, the hotel is modern from top to bottom, the staff were generally very friendly, and the Max&Erma's restaurant is open late which is good because the food selection after hours near the nationwide area (5-7 min walk) is not very inspiring. The room itself was big enough and as a bonus, the flat screen TV actually featured HD cable! A nice bonus when it's raining in Columbus. We had no problem with this hotel and will hope to get it again on Priceline for our next visit to Columbus.
reviews.title: My new favorite place in Columbus

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. Room was beautiful- very clean, up to date. Great beds. Room itself was a little on the small size, but since I was alone, this was not really an issue. Might be if traveling w/ kids, though. View great. Here are my 3 complaints, though:
reviews.title: Nice- but 3 complaints...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1- Tub and surround in the bathroom needed replacing. Looks like they tore out everything else and re-did it, except for the tub. There were bare spots w/ rusty metal sticking out. Stuck out like a sore thumb in the otherwise beautifully updated room and bathroom.
reviews.title: Thanks a million!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2- Service was a little spotty. Some front desk people were nice and warm and welcoming, and some acted a bit like I was bothering them. Same with the valets. When I admitted to the first valet that I encountered that I'd never valet parked my car before, and didn't really know how it worked, he looked down his nose at me as if I were a complete moron. A simple explanation would have sufficed and made my check-in a lot less stressful. The valet I encountered upon leaving on my last day was nice to me, but was grumbling and cursing under his breath about something. Made me a bit uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Clean hotel with small room, pay for parking and Internet

reviews.text: 3- Noise levels the first 2 nights were fine, since I beleive no one was staying on either side of me. However, on the 3rd night the room next to me was occupied and I could hear the TV, conversations, laughter, etc. into the wee hours. I decided not to complain because I didn't think the other guests were being overly loud, just that the walls were overly thin.
reviews.title: great location, new rooms but needs some fine tuning

reviews.text: Perfect location for Ohio State football game away from the OSU madness. Max and Ermas was great, and arena district was so much fun for our kids. Room was very clean, fridge was great to have. Lobby beautiful, hotel seems to connect with THE LOFTS, seems just as nice at a MUCH MUCH more reasonable price. One issue was not getting a wake up call when we requested one. It was a big inconvenience, because I ended up having to meet friends for breakfast with literally 2 minutes to spare. i mentioned this to the check out desk, not for any special treatment, but just to let them know there was a mix-up. Cindy, the director of guest services was wonderful! She offered compensation which more than made up for the getting late to breakfast. She was very apologetic and welcoming. I truly believed she felt badly for my situation and wasn't just doing her job. Am looking forward to returning when I can fit in another buckeye game. Parking was expensive, but probably normal for area.
reviews.title: LOVED LOVED LOVED HOTEL!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked on hotels.ca, we tried to check in at 1ish and prechecked in and had to come back around 3 which was fine, we drove around Columbus, which is very nice! The rooms were great, maybe considered a little small for 4 people, but there was only 2 of us so it was perfect. The valet parking was $21, and Internet was not included it was an additional $9.95. I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice room, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel through Hotwire and paid $75 which was a great deal in my opinion.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were specifically in town to see Cirque Du Soleil at Nationwide Arena. It is only 2 blocks walking distance away which was great since parking there is $15.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up

reviews.text: The rooms were great- large, comfortable bed, bathroom was fine- had new shower head. The room smelled great when we walked in.
reviews.title: Best Bed in the City!

reviews.text: I don't understand some of the negative reviews this hotel has gotten; I've stayed there at least twice, in December 2006 and April 2009, and it has been just fine. Dirty, uncomfortable, outdated rooms, and an unfriendly staff? Are we even talking about the same hotel, 33 E. Nationwide?
reviews.title: Don't understand the negative reviews

reviews.text: One thing I appreciated about my most recent visit was that though there was a noisy convention in house (a young cheerleaders' competition), the hotel put me on a quiet floor, isolated from that, where I slept just fine. Many hotels spread the noisy conventioneers/prom kids/frat boys around on every floor, so they disturb all the other people in-house.
reviews.title: Not for business travelers

reviews.text: This is an old hotel which they tried but did not succeed in remodeling into a business class hotel. I stayed here for 4 nights and the wireless Internet did not work at all. They do not have wired Internet service. The rooms are okay. The beds are great and the flat screen tv is wonderful but look closely at the room and it is dirty and shows its age.
reviews.title: Nothing to write home about!

reviews.text: What can I say? It was a place to stay! The hotel is large but older and the location was close to almost everything . Rooms were clean but not modern and a mini fridge and microwave were brought to my room for the duration of my stay at no extra charge. The staff was very friendly and there is a small store on the first level by the front desk just in case you forgot to bring something. Get in early though because the parking lot stays full Monday through Friday and the only entrance to the rooms is through the front door.
reviews.title: Great Suite for a downtown event!

reviews.text: I would have enjoyed my stay a little more if they had more than a handful of television stations most of which were sports. I was also on the 8th floor and had two sleepless nights because of high winds that made a terrible whistling noise through the windows.
reviews.title: Stylish renovation, great location, excellent staff

description: Treat yourself to our stunning, newly renovated hotel. The brand new breathtaking guest rooms and meeting space are brimming with all the hip and modern appointments you've come to enjoy. Conveniently located in the Arena District, the Crowne Plaza Hotel Columbus Downtown is attached to Nationwide Insurance and directly across the street from and attached to the Columbus Convention Center. This upscale downtown Columbus hotel is within walking distance of the North Market and fashionable Short North Neighborhood all packed with unique shopping, dining and nightlife. Nationwide Arena, home of the Columbus Blue Jackets and host to live performances year-round, is just 2 blocks away and is bordered by cobblestone streets lined with trendy restaurants and cafes. Our Lifestyle Hotel now includes new items like a game room for the kids, a state of the art business center, coffee bar and enjoy our tapas and wine menus at our Boulevard Bar. Enjoy live music or Broadway shows at the Palace or Ohio Theaters. Take in a live concert at the LC Pavilion or sit back and enjoy a movie at the Arena Grand Theatre. We are close to other Columbus destinations including the Museum of Art, COSI, Historic German Village, Victorian Village and The Ohio State University. The Crowne Plaza Hotel Columbus Downtown provides a perfect setting for successful business meetings, memorable social gatherings, and exquisite wedding receptions.
